address: Manila Ocean Park,  Roxas Boulevard, Luneta, City of Manila, Metro Manila
review: "Our short stay here is indeed filled with fun and laughter. My son loves the room where we have this big aquarium with numerous variety of fishes as part of the room's wall. Food selection is also reasonable. Definitely a great place for the whole family! And yes, the hotel staff are very polite and accommodating, it is really a plus!", 'If you want a staycation that is out of the ordinary .. Spend a night or maybe a day or two with famiky or friends at the Hotel H2O beside the Manila Ocean Park! We got one of their Marina Superior rooms and it was sooo cool! The interior is simple and modern but what will take your breath away is the installed aquarium walls that gives u a view of some of the amazing sea animals like fishes, sea horses ans jelly fish passing thru your walls as you relax. Truly a wonderful experience', 'we stayed here last june just on a whim. no occasion, we just wanted to relax. We were upgraded to a family suite. my teen son absolutely loved it. the room was very very spacious. we had a room and a separate living area. my son slept at the sleeping area coz he felt he had a room all to himself, with its own tv. The bathroom seems to be hazardous for small children since there was no door to just lock it. We had a jacuzzi, a separate shower and toilet areas. overall, it was really a relaxing stay. my only problem is that outside the hotel, it feels a bit crowded due to ocean park. it seems off to go the restaurant to have breakfast without dressing up, or to go to the pool since it feels a bit public. during the night, it was an eerie walk to the hotel lobby since you have to walk the expanse of a deserted ocean park.', "Are you looking for a unique place/room to stay at? Try H2O Hotel. Their rooms are big, good family of 4 and is indeed spacious, clean, organized and fresh smelling. PLUS PLUS PLUS... is their wall to wall aquarium is so nice and is very amazing! It's like you are sleeping under water. prices are also reasonable.", 'I like the aquarium-themed of the hotel. Very unique. :)', 'the hotel is nice, comfortable to stay , you get what you paid for.', 'expensive but its worth it', 'we stayed here for their easter sunday egg hunt for my son.. which we did not participate in because my son was just about 18mons. we got their Aqua Classic Room Promo and paid about Php 8000 for Rm 3140. this was a big aqua room where we had wall to wall aquarium that made my son happiest. the room was tastefully furnished & huge. we had a king sized bed with clean white sheets & a sofa bed. this room is great for a family of 4. our room had a small round table with 2 modern chairs, a 40inch flat screen tv to the delight of my boys & a business/ writing desk. their bathroom was spacious & it featured a rainshower head they also offered free wifi. the breakfast buffet was superb, this was served at the makansutra. they  had filipino breakfast fare, chinese dimsums & continental breakfast food. we also enjoyed their swimming pool but getting there was quite a task as this was near the hotel entrance. the staff was helpful & pleasant, checking & out was a breeze. but thinking back no one carried our overnight bags to the lobby downstairs but we were assisted when we reached their lobby. I would definitely go back & book the bayview room next because my son loves the ocean.     ', 'Great place to relax. Check out their rooms! see for yourselves :)', 'the first aquarium-themed integrated resort hotel in the Philippines!', 'Had an overnight stay with friends last weekend at Aqua Room...'

review: good value for money', 'Amazing customer service. We will surely be back for the buffet.', 'I believe Dusit is one of the first international hotels in Makati, and their service never fails to impress guests since then.', 'Good service from the front desk & hotel staff-very accommodating... Nice location too - near shopping malls & restaurants. I really enjoyed the buffet breakfast at Basix - have a great variety of foods to choose from to suit your taste buds.', 'Great food!', 'We had an office event here & we were welcomed by very courteous & accommodating staff. the rest rooms are immaculately clean. the international buffet spread they had for our group was really great! with special mention of their seafood rilette & fish fillet & sweets/ dessert station. ', 'Intriguing is the Sunday crossover buffet of the Dusit.  You register at the lobby and are given a tag then you are free to roam the hotel restaurants and get from any of the buffets available.  I find prepaying for a meal at a hotel a bit tacky but I suppose this is unavoidable since you are literally roaming the ground and mezzanine floor restaurants.  The restaurants are Thai, Continental, Italian and Japanese with the usual hotel buffet level food in terms of taste and quality.  two restaurants are in the ground floor and two on the mezzanine so you are literally climbing up and down stairs to get food.  Seating depends on which restaurant has an available table, whatever happens you will be going from restaurant to restaurant to get your pick of food.', 'Its the Dusit way of competing with the larger buffets of hotels such as Sofitel and the Makati Shang.  The experience is not bad and should be experienced by everyone at least once.', 'The reason I did not give this the full five stars for its unique approach is that I felt the service suffered a bit.  I guess with the prepayment this lessens the tips the staff receives which makes them a bit lethargic in dealing with guests.', 'Try the crossover buffet while its available.', 'Good!'

review: "Hotel Pontefino was located in Pasig. You can spend your night here after attending a party and they have a room for you according to your budget. review: "I've ordered from Ping ping Litson many times for the past two years - can count at least 10 times - and each time, they have come through with flying colors.  Delivery is always ahead of time.  If their delivery crew cannot find the place, they call up and ASK.  Even if they're based in Quezon City, I've asked them to deliver to Makati or Paranaque without a problem.  TIP: If you want to retain the crispy skin on the lechon, don't remove the wrapping; let it stay until you're ready to eat.  We've done this many times and each time, the skin stays crispy.  Happy Eating!"

review: My friends said Ristras would make a good venue for a me-date, but when I bit into their burrito, the flavorless rice inside made me feel lonelier than ever.', 'Once upon a time, I loved you.', 'Used to be really good, but not anymore. Sayang.', 'Sa sarap ng burrito ng Ristras, sumasamba akong kakayanin ko ang Godzilla Burrito Challenge.', 'One of the best mexican restos in town. I keep on coming back for their burrito which is their bestseller.', "Mexican cuisine is finally making a comeback in the Metro. Ristras, just like Orale, is turo-turo or cafeteria, rather than Cantina-style. Semi DIY, they'll assist you as you choose what to combine with your basic menu choice: choose a burrito, and you have beans choices, meats, and veggies. Meats range from carnitas or pulled pork, roast beef, lengua, chicken, etc. Mexican cantina food is fragrant and quite healthy, so this is now my go-to when I don't want to fuss. They're dynamite (a pepper filled cheese flauta) is the chief disappointment. Which is too bad considering it'd be great with beer. And they lack Mexican beer choices, unlike Orale."
